critique: This document is an executive order from 1936 that expands the Uinta National Forest in Utah. It is a relatively straightforward land management decision. Ideological Tilt: This is a fairly neutral action, not strongly tied to any particular ideology.Immigration Approach: This has nothing to do with immigration.Executive Power: It does expand executive power slightly by setting aside land, but it is within the bounds of existing legislation.Federalism: It strengthens federal control over land management in Utah.National Security vs. Civil Liberties: This has no bearing on national security or civil liberties.Economic Regulation: This has a minor impact on economic regulation by potentially restricting resource extraction on the land.Social Inclusion: This has no impact on social inclusion.
